12221.content:
Whilst being carried to the carpenter’s quarters, the judder of cannon fire threw Catalina from the arms of her carriers, once again knocking her out cold.

Upon opening her eyes, she immediately became aware of the agonizing pain shooting down her leg. Glancing around for help, she could see the lifeless body of Jim to her left, lying in a pool of blood and shattered ship. Neither Garrett nor Thomas, or any other living soul, were to be seen beyond the many more bodies that were strewn across that deck. That was when the smell of battle reached Catalina. The foul, sticky mix of blood, gunpowder and tar burned her nostrils and the salt, sea air bit at her leg wound. She soon realised that she was alone on the Quarter Deck, alone with only the pain and ghostly silence to comfort her.

Using all the upper body strength she could muster, she hauled herself towards the steps that led to the main deck. Once near the top she realised that she was wrong in her assumption of being alone on the ship for, standing there on the deck was at least two boarding party’s worth of pirates surrounding the surviving remainder of her crew. Scanning the faces she recognised Thomas’ and a few other survivors and let loose a sigh of relief. This feeling of relief was to be short-lived as the broadswords, held firmly in the hands of the marauding buccaneers, were being forcefully thrust towards the crewmembers. Straining to hear what was being said, she heard an order for the Captain of the ship to be brought forward. Glowing with pride, Catalina watched as the crew remained silent, unwilling to fulfil this heathen’s request. Movement below her redirected her attention and she watched with sorrow as her Captain was brought in front of the pirates. Once again Catalina’s heart swelled with pride by the Captain’s dignified approach, not once did he appear to have any fear in his heart. Calmly, he addressed the pirates, “I command, as Captain of this ship, that you release my crew immediately and disembark from this vessel to the one from which you came, leaving at once.” At which the pirates exchanged amused glances and sniggered. A cold, evil laugh that sent chills right through Catalina’s body. It was a sound that would haunt her until the end of her days. Sniggering over, the pirates jabbed their swords towards the crew again and issued their commands. Unable to hear well enough, Catalina edged forward, unaware that she was becoming increasingly visible in the sight of the pirate gang.

The commands declared by the pirates were
12221.title: The Boarding Party

choices: Catalina stays on the burning ship
Catalina boards the pirate ship
122212.content:
Holding tightly to the railings at the top of the steps, Catalina could just make out the words being spat from the pirate crew. She was surprised to learn that they had no interest in robbing their cargo, which was actually nothing more than food and supplies for the British army that had recently been evacuated from the American Colonies. She had only ever known of pirates thieving from merchant ships and couldn’t fathom what other possible reasons they would have for their boarding. With her head through the banister she could just make out the voices of the trespassing pirates.
“You have two options. One, you join our crew and become a pirate, or we send you down to the locker. What’ll be?”
Catalina was puzzled by this demand. Judging by the number of pirates currently aboard her ship, she wouldn’t have expected them to be short of hands, especially as there were bound to be more still lurking on the vessel alongside them. Casting a glance over the rail confirmed that there were indeed a handful of men still aboard the offensive ship.

A sudden scuffle below on the main deck reminded Catalina of the present situation. Much to her dismay, some of her crew had refused to become part of such a crew and had been thrown overboard. Those left on deck became much more nervous and she could see that a few of them had been press-ganged already. Once the crew had realised that the threats were real, more agreed to the pirate’s demands and were escorted onto the corrupt ship. The last pirates who left lit torches and threw them towards the remaining crew members, of which there were not many but did include both the Captain and Thomas in their group.
122212.title: Re-recruitment

choices: Catalina gets a place on the lifeboat
She gets left on the ship
1222121.content:
Once the pirates had left and their ship began retreating, Catalina was once again reminded of the agonising pain in her leg. Her gaze turned distractedly to the main deck where the last members of the crew were busily falling back under the command of the Captain and attempting to salvage what they could of the burning ship. From her position above the deck, Catalina could see the fire was spreading ferociously without a hope of the crew stopping it or even merely containing it to the deck, it was quickly devouring everything on board, reaching into the cabins and climbing the masts. It was a devastating sight.

Captivated by the sight of the fire and the crew frantically trying to control it, Catalina felt helpless, unable to move, let alone assist them. It was then that the main mast was conquered. She could hear the wood splitting as the flames devoured it. Calling out to the crew, drawing their attention to it, Catalina warned the men below just in time before it came crashing to the deck, taking with it a large chunk of the starboard side.

Her shouts also alerted Thomas to her position and he joined her within seconds.
“Catalina? Come, on. Let’s get you off this ship. There’s no saving her now.” The sorrow in his voice was not hard to miss. Thomas had been on the Curious Jane since he’d been a boy of 12, working his way up through the ranks on the modest merchantman, earning the respect of his crewmates and the approval of the Captain. Catalina knew this from their many conversations of their after-dinner stroll across the decks. It had been six days since they had left the English harbour of Portsmouth and in this time, Thomas had opened up to her, as she had done to him. She knew he aspired to follow in the footsteps of his father and own his own trading company but she also knew that he loved this, now weakening, ship as his home, as it had been for the past 11 years, and that this was to be the present Captain’s final voyage before commencing his retirement. Thomas was to get the ship and subsequently be able to follow his dream. A dream that was now going up in smoke.

It was a sombre moment as he carried Catalina down the steps to the main deck. To her dismay, she realised there was only the one remaining lifeboat that was still sea-worthy, the rest lost to the flames. The crew gathered round and it was clear they would not all be able to cram into the small craft.
1222121.title: The Lat Boat

choices: Thomas stays on the ship
Thomas accepts a place on the lifeboat
12221211.content:
Thomas lowers Catalina into the lifeboat and turns to the other crew members who now realise that some of them will have to be left aboard the burning ship.
Shock soon turned into panic as they all tried to beat each other to the remaining seats on the lifeboat. Thomas attempted to take control.

“Gentlemen, now is not the time to panic. Let’s decide this in a fair manner.” Reluctantly the crew obeyed the order, for although Thomas was not the most senior of officers present, he had the respect of the crew and of the Captain, which made him important enough in the eyes of the regular crew members.

Much to the dismay of the survivors, the lifeboat left undamaged was one of the smaller that the Curious Jane carried, one of a pair that carried only eight men, compared to the larger pair which held double that each. Thomas looked around the deck, making a quick headcount – from the crew of forty six that they had left Portsmouth with, thirteen men now stood before him.

“Captain Rogers, sir. Would you care to climb into the lifeboat, while I take charge here, I...”
“No, Thomas. I won’t be getting into the lifeboat.”
“But you’re the Captain, sir. You get priority over...”
“No. I receive no priority here. It is my duty as Captain to ensure the safety of my crew and I have failed that duty. Over half my crew lie dead across my boards, I shall not run to safety and allow another of my men to die while I live in his place. I will go down with this ship and with my men. Thank you, Thomas but my place remains here, you will take over the command of these men.”
“Very well, Captain. I understand. I too will remain on board, alongside you, sir, as I have always done.”
“No, Thomas, these men need someone to lead them once you have reached land, I trust it to you to honour this position, as will they. You have served me well, these long years, now, it’s your turn to take command.”
“Captain, I...”
12221211.title: Captain's Orders

choices: Fainted clean away
Regained her senses
122212111.content: Thomas stepped next to the Captain, a look of dignity and pride on his face. He also looked frightened. Catalina reached out her hand. "Thomas," she called. "You have to try to get off!" Thomas looked into her eyes. She took a deep breath when he said, "No, Catalina. My place is here." He turned to a sailor, pointing a Catalina. "Make her life more valuable than yours." He pushed the sailor into the lifeboat. Catalina let out a sob as the crew pushed away from the sinking ship. Thomas stood tall and strait by the Captain. As the boat got farther away, smoke wrapped around the ship, blocking all from view. Catalina felt herself becoming faint. She grabbed the wrist of the sailor who'd been ordered to take care of her. She gasped for breath and......
122212111.title: Thomas stays on the ship

choices: Wait for help
123.content:
You run to Thomas. He was right and he should know it. You make it to the Captain's cabin and knock on the door. Thomas opened it.

"It is a pirate ship." You announce proudly. Unconciously you have placed your hands behind your back in the old school way. "It's got that flag, the... oh, what's it called?"

"I told you she was, sir." Thomas isn't even looking at you. "She's a black hull too, meanin' she's likely the Avenger, and that means Gerry's the Cap'n."

"I know the Avenger." The Captain says coldly. "Miss Sherwood are you sure you saw the Skull and Crossbones?"

"That's it. Yes, quite sure." Then you hear the first blast. "What's that?"

"Everyone down!" A cry comes.

Suddenly you are thrown off of your feet and into the passageway. You stand up and pull down your skirt indignantly. "Thomas!" You run through the passage again and shriek, grabbing behind you for the floor. You've fallen through a cannon hole and all that is below you is rushing sea water. "Help! Help!" You cry.
123.title: Cannons

choices: Grab the Captain's Corpse...
Fall into the foaming water...
1231.content:
Help is not forthcoming. And, as you hang there, you realize that you will have to do something or you'll fall. You swing your legs delicately, determined not to look down at the rushing water. And a shoe catches... and slips. But there's hope. There must be a kind of shelf or ripped wood, some kind of ledge. You swing your legs again, now with purpose and when that doesn't work you realize that you have to look down. You gulp, take a deep breath and let your eyes fall.

You scream. There, beneath you, where your legs caught is the captain's body. His eyes stare lifelessly up your skirt and your scream makes you teeter and fall. You are falling towards the rushing and foaming water and when your hand catches something that is fast growing cold, waxy, and stiff you have to make a choice, in an instant...
1231.title: Disgusting and Distressing Decisions

choices: you give up- and wait for them to reach you, it's inevitable
you decide to go down now rather than chance it with the pirates
124.content:
A pirate ship you realize it definately is. And with not allowing Thomas to go for the captain immediately, you realize that you wasted precious time. The pirate ship will definately be capable of capturing your father's small, poorly armed, vessel. Your panic is increasing.

You decide that you want to do something while you still can control fate. You quickly move to the far side of the ship and hoist yourself onto the rail.

You look around quickly to observe no one is watching. You are certain they will assume that you have taken to hiding in your stateroom and will not bother with you during the emergency. You see the ship nearing. You are able to make out the port holes and metallic gleams from within- guns.

You hesitate no more as you push yourself over the side into the Atlantic.

My god! You repeat some of the crew's language that you never should have heard. You had forgotten how icy cold the Atlantic could be. No matter, you've chosen now and there is no turning back.

You know you need to get as far from the ship as possible. The last things you want are to be spotted or to be able to hear the cries of the crew as they are tortured and then killed. Your own suffering will be enough to bear. You strike out away from the ship slowly with your skirts hampering you.

After a few minutes of swimming as you quickly become tired, you realize you aren't alone in the water. There is a small craft approaching you.

You realize they have spotted you and you are their intended target.
124.title: swimming for life. or death

choices: do you approach him to ask?
do you keep to the back hoping he'll forget?
1241.content:
The craft is approaching and it is filled with unkept men. In the front directing operations is swarthy dark pirate.

The site of him fills you with fear and you turn and attempt to swim farther away. Never! You wouldn't want to chance it with the likes of them.

With sudden speed you feel the iron grip of a hand along your collar, wrenching you out of the water. You struggle, kicking and flailing with all your might. Screaming is pointless, there is no one to hear you, and it would only waste energy.

He drags you onto the boat. You lie in the water collected in the bottom, exhausted, looking up at your captor. You feel annoyed with yourself because you know how weak you seem, drenched, shivering which he'll certainly mistake for shaking, with fear filled eyes.

He's staring rudely at youbemused. There's a the beginning of what could possibly be a small smile playing on his face. You feel even more ridiculous than before. To him you're only a game.

He leans down running his large, calloused hand from your brow down to your chin and tilting your chin up staring into your face.

You have the sudden realization he might be about to kiss you. You stare back at him, waiting, your pulse racing.

He presses his thumb to your lips parting them slightly. You hold your body rigid to prevent your body from betraying your thoughts, fears, and emotions.

Suddenly he drops your head, which thumps into the rough board on the bottom, back into the puddle of water. You realize what an awckward position that was for your neck. You want to gingerly rub it, but you don't want to move.

"Back to the ship," he issues an order to the men. These are the first words spoken the entire time.

Lying there helpless you anayse his voice. Although it was gruff as you expected it. He had spoken english and not some savage language. There was also something gentile about it.

He pays no more attention to you, instead peering at the ship they are nearing. You want to look up, but decide that might not be wise.

...

You've reached the ship now. There is a big jolt and crew on board begins to pull the boat in. This is the first boat to return. You sit up with your knees together, and pointing one way, your feet the other, leaning back on your hands, resting your head and back against the side.

As the boat finishes its journey, the rowers begin to disembark. New hands reach in and take ahold of you roughly. You feel ashamed at their vulgar touch, very much unlike his touch, and feel your face glow.

Your pulled roughly to your feet onboard. You wonder what is to become of you. You note that he seems to have forgotten about you.
1241.title: first encounter

choices: do you talk to the captain, confronting him?
do you leave without a word?
12412.content:
You stand there, shivering. You don't feel ready for another encounter with him. You aren't sure of how you'd react. Your arms are crossed holding your elbows. Your head is tilted slighly down, subdued, your eyes are watching, if not alertly, the activities aboard, the men moving back and forth in set patterns like a dance.

You feel the eyes of someone else on you. You look up to see he is watching you. When he catches your eyes, he motions without a word for you to follow him. Wordlessly you weave through the men, falling in line behind him, to enter the darkness of the ship beneath.

....

He takes you to the captain's quarters. Or what you assume at least are the captain's quarters. He bids you to remain in the outer room and he enters into the inner room. Alone you look around. The room is basically bear. One port hole provides the dingy light. You see now where to sit, so you remain standing, slighly off the center of the room starting a puddle on the floor.

Inside you hear another voice, this one less gentile, but at the same time less harsh begin to yell. All you can make out that it is at your captor for apparently not obeying orders to board the ship, instead choosing to go after you.

At that moment, a greasy appearing, small man of no distinguishable age, bent over due to the brutality the years had shown him with greedy beady eyes appeared beckoning you to follow into the room.

You shudder at his appearance, but follow his command. Entering you hear, the last of your captors speech. "There is something to her, something making her more than the wife of a crew member, she will be worth the cost of her trouble, a heavy ranson could be had for her." You realize he must have seen you the entire time, the heedless flight off your father's ship which now you greatly regret.

You are aware of the captain looking you over. The conversation in the room has died out and an awkward silence has taken over. He is examining you. Your drowned rat appearance, your stylish clothes, your miskept, snarled hair, your figure. He's peering into you, behind the outer layer, you realize. Not into you, he isn't capable of that, but you realize he's attempting to do so.

You refuse to look down. You meet his stare, if not exactly, looking directly at him, at least you don't turn away, and you feel shame mount on your face as he picks each part of you to pieces, mentally feasting on you. Oddly enough, at least compared to standing up on deck, you are relieved your captor has remained in the room. You would never want to be alone with the captain and his steward for fear of that harm that could befall you.

"Take her to a far room" the captain announces.
12412.title: boarding the new ship

choices: do you attempt to prepare yourself for you first visitor?
do you remain facing the wall and pretend to still be asleep?
124122.content:
You leave, following your captor, relieved to be out the presence of the captain and his helper. You wonde what he means by the far room, what sort of room it is and thankfull realize it's probably far from the captain's quarters.

Without a word he shows you to a room, opening the door for you. You enter having no other sensible choice. The room is dark. Behind you, you hear the door closing and the sound of the key in the locker, trapping you in your new quarters. Before the door closes completely you see a bed, more like a bunk, built low, into the wall and floor on the left against the outer wall with a port hole a few feet from it. The room isn't large; it's very small. The right side of the room is bare, and just to your left along the door-wall is a trunk with what appears to be a pillow and two blankets.

You fumble through the dark to the trunk and grab a blanket wrapping it around yourself for warmth and cast yourself on the bed.

....

You awake. It is still dark. However, there is a strange flickering orange light coming in. With the blanket still around you, you stand up, tripping over your shoes where you had kicked them off and make your way to the port hole.

The orange light dancing vaguely through the room you realise are flames- flames from the burning mass of a nearby ship- your father's ship. You stand watching the flames. Drifting in and out of sleep. Soon a faint haze of light pink light appears on the horizon.

You return to the bunk and fall asleep again.

...

You are awakened when it is much lighter by the sound of a key gratjng in the lock.
124122.title: new quarters

1241222.content:
Hugo walked in the door. He exhaled at the sight of her figure on the small cot. Her body was perfectly curved. He recalled how it had felt to pull her out of the water into his arms. He closed his eyes remembering the intoxicating smell of her.

His skin tingled as he felt his need of her grow. To run his hands against that smooth skin, To run his finger threw her hair his urges were undeniable as he strood to the bed to wake her.He strooked her cheek, and began to run his finger down to her breast.

Reality gripped him, making his hand draw back. He was being foolish. Hugo convinced himself it was simple infatuation and nothing else. I mean when was last time he had been with a woman? too long. And what about her feelings? He knew that he shouldnt care about what she thought but something deep inside of him could not bring himself to use her to his pleasure.
Angered by his conflicting feelings, Hugo left the room with a slam of the the door
1241222.title: Conflicting feelings

choices: You try to get away again
You give in to the pirates and go with them
1242.content: You duck under the water and manage to swim a few minutes before you feel the need to come up for air. Your head feels blurry and you arn't thinking clearly. You panic as you take a breath of salty ocean water and it seeps quickly into your lungs. You give into the strong current of water that if forcing you down, down, down. Suddenly you feel yourself being lifted, and you body goes limp as the strong arms of a man lift you from an otherwise watery grave and hold you close to them, and you can feel there heart beating against the warmth of your cheek. You are too weak to move but you peek up at the man that is holding you. He is dark and very hansome, with black hair and dazzling green eyes. He looks down at your shaking wet body against his and almost smiles but you are too cold and afraid to smile back. The rocking of the boat lulls you gently to sleep as you row. Then, with a jult, you realize that you are in a rowboat with the very pirates that you were running away from. Yet, you're not sure if they will harm you or not, for you are some comfortable and you feel so safe in the arms of the dark pirate.
1242.title: The rescue

choices: Do you go investigate
Or stay and wait for some sign.
125.content:
You race down into the hull. It's dark and you barely see an open crate in the dim darkness. You rush over and pull the top of it over you. It's small and the air gets really warm so you take off all the clothes you can (within deascency levels). Sweat is sarting to fall down your face.
Silently you wait for what seems like forever. It very cramped in the crate and your body is starting to ache. Up on deck you can hear the beginings of fighting. You hold your breath and pray to the Lord that your father's men can hold thir own against the pirates. Your heart is pounding and you are trembling dispite the heat. Shortly it's over. All is quiet.
125.title: Damn it's hot

choices: Knee him in the Privates :)
Pray that he'll show mercie
Offer him something if he'll let her live
1251.content:
Slowly, she crept out of the crate that had become her savior. Drenched in sweat, she gulped in the sea air as soon as the lid was removed. She briefly considered putting her clothes back on, but decided that her undergarments would have to do, for it was difficult to be stealthy in a petticoat.
Crawling up the stairs, she heard the muffles sounds of celebration and laughter. But which side had won? There was only one way to find out. Gently, she lifted the trap door that led to the deck, only to have it smashed down heavily by someone's foot. She waited a minute, holding her breath until the footsteps faded away, and then she tried to open the hatch again.
This time she met no resistance, and dared to peek out of the small space.
The victors were dumping bodies overboard, inspecting cabins and cheering. The pirates had won. Dismay crossed the young girl's face as she saw the captain's corpse fall into the sea, pushed by two ruthless men wearing ripped pantaloons and wide, V necked T shirts. She had never seen pirates before today, and despite her disgust at all that was happening, she was curious of what these people were like. They all dressed alike, wearing bright colors and thick buckled boots. Most of them wore head dressings such as bandannas, though some were bald. Catalina couldn't help but notice that all of these men wore an extensive amount of Jewelry, usually gold bands with a precious gem in the middle. There were also necklaces, bracelets, and earrings, all gold and silver. Catalina could have sworn that she even saw a glimmer of gold in a man's mouth, posing as a tooth!
Her studies were suddenly interrupted by the appearance of two pirates coming from the captains quarters. The first thing that she noticed was that both of these men wore black, although the taller one was distinguished by a typical captain's hat and cape. The next thing that she noticed was that they were heading right for her below deck! In a panic, she dropped the trap door and bolted down the stairs. Leaping over her deserted attire, she clambered back into her original hiding place.
After carefully putting the lid back on the crate, she tried to calm her breathing down in order to hear.
The hatch opened, and she heard a voice say:
"No, Crimby, I want you to see if the ship still has some cargo in it. They might have picked up some merchandise in the last port, unlikely though it may be."
"As you wish, Captain." a deeper voice replied.
She heard one pair of footsteps stomp down the stairs, and then a pause as i reached the bottom.. The silence lasted a full two minutes, and Catalina began to panic. Shifting slightly, she was able to see through a minuscule hole on the side of the crate.
There was one of the darkly dressed men, standing as still as a statue except for his head, which revolved slowly around the room, surveying as if looking for a good hiding place. Catalina could hardly guess his actions until her eyes rested on the floor, where she had left-
Oh gods! The dress!
She must have emitted a small gasp because suddenly the man charged towards the crate, and drew a wicked looking dagger from his belt. He pulled the lid off with little effort, and yanked Catalina out of her sanctuary roughly.
"Please! She screamed. "Please, don't kill me!" But he already had the dagger to her throat, and she feared for the worst.
1251.title: Do you go investigate

Curled up in your crate you to stay where you are. Lord knows what could happen. If only you knew for sure that your father's men had one. YOu decided tho pray some more... Wait a minute that means you!!!

As soon as Catalina hears the pirate, her life flashed before her eyes and she felt sick at the bottom of her stomache. She can hear them shuffling around, and cusing that there was nothing here and the only option was to burn the place.

The attackers started up the stairs, and with every step Catalina's impending fate became all the more real. After a few seconds she could no longer take it and she jumped up and screamed "Lord don't let me die!"

info.brief_description: A girl falls in love with a pirate. Is it a true love?
info.description:
Catalina Sherwood, just a normal twenty year old coming back from England, and is on her way back to the United States. Her parents had sent her to a college in England. They want her to be a school teacher. Someone who is very proper, polite, and neat. On her way home, she has a run in with a ship full of pirates. They attack her ship, and kill everyone on board, except for her. When she comes out of hiding, she spots a very handsome pirate.

She goes onto their ship and through all of the terror aboard ship. She begins to have feelings for this mysterious pirate. Is it really just true love? Or just lust?

--------------------------------------------------
ATTENTION!: I would like to explain somethings before you continuing reading. I've seen you add in that Hugo is the captain. He's NOT a captain, just a pirate. I would also like to add that there shouldn't be any rape or kinky sex. If you'd like, you can put in sexual acts, but don't get graphic. I'll edit or delete chapters that don't specifically address this. I hope that you will follow the two things I've asked of you. Please don't blow the story out of proportion, or I'll add more regulations to this story!
